Package com.mystic_alchemy.ics2java

Class CalendarParser

java.lang.Object
com.mystic_alchemy.ics2java.CalendarParser
public class CalendarParser extends Object
Parses an iCal ics file into a Calendar. The resulting calendar can include none, one or many Events.

The iCal file (type ics) has to be correctly formed, as malformed iCal files will result in a not correctly parsed calendar.

Since:
0.1
Version:
0.1
Author:
PilleniusMC for Mystic-Alchemy

  • Method Details

    • readEventStringsFromICS

      public static ArrayList<String> readEventStringsFromICS​(String icsPath)
      Reads all VEVENTs from a passed iCalendar file and strips the BEGIN and END tags from them. It doesn't edit the events themselves though, they just get pushed into a formatted string.

      Simple file checks are done at the start of the method, so that only files of the type ics in iCalendar format are actually read, to prevent malformed output.

      It converts an event of the format
      BEGIN:VEVENT
      UID:affe69deadbeef
      DTSTAMP:20010101T120000Z
      LOCATION: On the world
      DESCRIPTION:A long description of what the even entails. Including possible further info.
      SUMMARY: Short descriptor
      RRULE:FREQ=YEARLY
      DTSTART;VALUE=DATE:20010101
      END:VEVENT
      to the format
      UID:affe69deadbeef|DTSTAMP:20010101T120000Z|LOCATION: On the world|DESCRIPTION:A long description of what the even entails. Including possible further info.| SUMMARY: Short descriptor|RRULE:FREQ=YEARLY|DTSTART;VALUE=DATE:20010101

      Parameters:
      icsPath - Path to the iCalendar file (type .ics)
      Returns:
      an array of the content of all detected VEVENT elements
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when a non-existent file or a file of the wrong type is passed

    • parseEventString

      public static Event parseEventString​(String eventString)
      Parses the VEVENT strings, which are extracted from an iCalendar file by readEventStringsFromICS(String).

      This only parses the UID, DESCRIPTION, SUMMARY, RRULE, LOCATION and DTSTART from a VEVENT. The method is also pretty dumb due to the need to limit complexity.

      Parameters:
      eventString - the content of an iCalendar even as a String with | as its delimiter
      Returns:
      the parsed event
